field.name: description
field.value: Using the SessionScopeModule the default FlushAction of the SessionScope is FlushAction.Config. According to how I understnd it, the flush behaviour shall be read from the config, which is the case for example in AbstractScope.SetFlushMode method, where the declared 'flush="Transaction"' is respected. The Flushmode of the used Session is "Never", which is totally right. Nevertheless, it is flushed on th end on the end of an http request because of the SessionScope.PerformDisposal method.

comment.author: mzywitza
comment.text:
When flush="transaction" is set, the SessionScope has to flush the changes when it commits the implicit transaction of the scope.
If I did not understand you correctly, please reopen the issue and attach your configuration and a code sample that illustrates the issue.
